overview:
As Chief Operating Officer for NaviSite, Jim Pluntze is focused on driving the company’s operational efficiencies and ensuring ongoing execution excellence. He is responsible for the organizations day-to-day operations, worldwide service delivery, infrastructure, and internal systems. Jim leads NaviSite’s strategic planning process to ensure that the company achieves optimum efficiency while maximizing profits and exceeding customer service goals. Prior to his role as COO, he served as chief financial officer where he successfully led NaviSite’s financing efforts and the team in the sale of the company to Time Warner Cable in April, 2011. Jim joined NaviSite in 2002 as the Chairman of the Audit Committee on the Board of Directors. During his tenure he has been instrumental in NaviSite’s acquisition and integration strategy and debt restructuring.

Jim has over 20 years of experience in financial and operational executive leadership roles in the high tech industry. Prior to NaviSite he held senior positions at Lanthorn Technology, Guardent, Inc., and Razorfish where he was responsible for venture capital fundraising, merger and acquisition activities, and the implementation of financial systems and controls for both domestic and international operations.
